channel.title: [C4D] Pen
channel.description:
I was a bit bored and started a bit of c4d. This is my first object so its not the best or complex
[img]http://www.fileden.com/files/2008/4/1/1847192/pen.jpg[/img]
I added some lighting effects Please tell me how I could improve etc.

item.title: [C4D] Pen
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:5, topic:289700”]I would appreciate if you could direct me towards a good tutorial in making a decent scene etc.
Furthermore, a tutorial in lighting and shadows would be very useful since I got a bit confused with it.

ps. tell me good colours for my pen, the ones I have look horrible.[/quote]

http://magic-monkey.deviantart.com/art/Stochastic-Render-Tutorial-19005037

http://planetpixelemporium.com/tutorialpages/global.html

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Pen
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

I would appreciate if you could direct me towards a good tutorial in making a decent scene etc.
Furthermore, a tutorial in lighting and shadows would be very useful since I got a bit confused with it.

ps. tell me good colours for my pen, the ones I have look horrible.

item.title: [C4D] Pen
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

I thought my pen was better, if only for the colours.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Pen
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Yes MUCH better than pretty much all the other pens here.

Just lose that terrible background, put it in a scene, at least a studio setup.

And the tip looks weird.

And bevel the edges of the clip part.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Pen
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Yay a new person stumbles into C4D

Its not that bad at all for a first. Now get a nice scene with lights
